column2: Work closely with software developers and operations teams to ensure the reliability and uptime of our software applications and infrastructure           Design and implement systems and processes to monitor and improve the reliability and availability of our software applications and systems           Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks and infrastructure issues         Develop and implement monitoring and alerting systems to ensure the timely detection of issues         Work with teams to establish reliability targets and drive continuous improvement efforts         Develop and implement disaster recovery plans to ensure business continuity in the event of a system failure         Stay up to date with the latest advances in reliability engineering tools and methodologies, and identify opportunities to improve the reliability and scalability of our systems           Requirements:           Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field         3+ years of experience in systems administration or software development, with a focus on reliability engineering         Strong understanding of Linux/Unix systems administration, and experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud         Experience with monitoring and alerting systems such as Nagios, Zabbix, or Prometheus         Strong problem-solving and analytical skills         Excellent communication and collaboration skills
column11: Unix, Computer science, Analytical skills, Linux, Disaster recovery, Infrastructure, Reliability engineering, Continuous improvement, Business continuity, Application software

column1: L2 and L3 Laptop Chip Level Repair Technician
column2: Interested candidates can share their CVs to WhatsApp:   9513059205.   ( Abhishek Pareek) Should Know the Below Skills.     WhatsApp:   9513059205 Job Description for L2-Repair   Understanding of Schematic, Signal flow and board view Identification of components, Package of the components and able to read the datasheet of all the available components on the board.  Awareness of BIOS function, requirement of re-programming and re-work of BIOS Chip.  Capable of testing of all the passive components such as Capacitors, Resistors, Inductors, Diodes etc. Troubleshooting and rectification of  Knowledge of power on sequence Rectify voltage issues and rectifying short circuits all DC Voltages (- 19v, 3.3v & 5v) First level of repair related to all function failures (fault related to associated circuit) Rework of  Small SMD & PTH components Rework of  all Ports, Sockets and Connectors Job Description for L3-Repair  Excellent rework knowledge of all components (Excluding BGA rework) Handling track building activity  Motherboard power on sequence Debug issue of CPU & BGA related issue & declare for BGA rework Expert to diagnose the circuit voltage & signals through Board view and circuit diagram  All Component Identification and functions Awareness of handing the BIOS rework/re-program Short Circuit rectification for all Voltages and Signals  Input & Output Signal & Voltage knowledge of all sections of the circuits Problem finding and troubleshoot to pinpoint exact failed component and rectification Helping in Troubleshooting guidelines preparation Able to train down the line (L1/L2) for next level by On the Job Training
column11: Debug issue of CPU & BGA, BGA rework, Understanding of Schematic, BIOS Chip, Signal flow, BIOS function
